steps.content: Welcome to NVIDIA JupyterLab! This customized environment includes GPU monitoring, auto-loaded notebooks, and NVIDIA branding.
Your notebooks from the cloned repository appear here. You can open them by double-clicking.
The file browser shows all available notebooks and files. Navigate through your repository structure here.
Access GPU Dashboards from the View menu. Note: GPU metrics only appear when NVIDIA GPUs are available (use --gpus all with Docker).
Monitor your running kernels and terminals here. GPU memory usage is tracked for each kernel when GPUs are available.
The status bar shows kernel status and GPU utilization when available.
Create new notebooks, Python files, or terminals from the File menu.
Find additional resources and documentation in the Help menu. You can restart this tour anytime from Help > Welcome Tour.
Click View menu to access GPU Dashboards
This is the file browser. Use it to load or switch between notebooks and navigate your repo.
Open GPU Dashboards here to review live GPU metrics (utilization, memory, PCIe, NVLink).
GPU Dashboards will open as new tabs showing: GPU Utilization, GPU Memory, PCIe Throughput, and NVLink status.

In notebooks, you can use nvidia-ml-py to programmatically access GPU metrics:

import pynvml
pynvml.nvmlInit()
handle = pynvml.nvmlDeviceGetHandleByIndex(0)
info = pynvml.nvmlDeviceGetMemoryInfo(handle)
Restart kernels from here if GPU memory needs to be freed.
